page.title: 07Modern Chelmsford School (2)
page.content: The playgrounds of old schools were small and there were no fields for games. The old people told us that their teachers were very strict and quite often hit children for getting their work wrong when they did not understand it. Our teachers are more understanding. They allow us to {experiment for ourselves}and discuss our work with other children. Talking was never allowed in school fifty years ago. We{learn by experience.}We use{practical ideas}to help us to understand our work and we are allowed to{write our own views}about all the work that we do. We think we would not have liked school fifty years ago. It seemed very strict and the teachers were too hard on the children. I think we are very lucky today compared with fifty years ago.
